reviewText: Product received for free\n\nWhat a phenomenal preview of the future. That was beautiful and so very immersive. I can't wait until all music videos are like this.
voteText: 25 of 25 people (100%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nThis is an amazing VR experience. It is short but it takes an important first step in making a music video actually work in VR. Now I have seen other music videos in VR like the Run the Jewels video which is part of Wevr Transport. Even though that video was also great it had a fixed camera and it felt more like watching a 360 video(which is basically what it was) and less like I was actually in that space. Surge is different in that it is made in the Unreal Engine and has positional tracking and the whole package which means you feel like you are actually there. Couple that with amazing set pieces which go along perfectly with the music and cram it into a short music video and you have Surge. Its free so I definitively recommend you try it out.
voteText: 11 of 11 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewerDisplayName: L y n x u s
reviewText:
Quite good really. Nice little expirence & free.

Would be great to see something like this that had a VR visulisation of tracks you play from your own list. Difference scenes etc.

All in all great for what is a very young VR industry.

reviewText: Highly recommended - a cool, short experience showing the future of music videos!\n\nUPDATE: Sync issues for the Vive have just been fixed, so it works great now! Thanks to the creator for a quick response to user feedback on this.

reviewText:
Holy amazeballs this was so surreal and crazy awesome. Do recommend. There's a sync issue on high resolution, though, so play it at medium. Otherwise the animation drags and the song cuts out halfway through.

Really cool stuff, though. I look forward to more like it.

(Played on Rift CV1 with GTX970)

EDIT: An update has fixed the sync issue when playing on High Resolution. Now it's perfect! Thanks!

Product received for free

Animations and music are no longer sync'd. :(

The delay isn't quite as bad if I lower the resolution to medium, but even then, there's still a noticable delay. Don't remember experiencing that on the DK2 version.

Definltely an objectively awesome song, with amazing visuals provided for free, so I definitely still recommend it, but be warned, the visual glitches and desync can detract from the original experience quite a bit.

UPDATE: Devs released a fix pretty quicky. Two words to describe the video: ♥♥♥♥ing glorious.

reviewText:
Fantastic passive experience on my Oculus Rift CV1, reminiscent of Rez in art style.

Only problem is that it only lasts about 5 minutes, I could easily stay in that virtual world for a lot longer standing in awe. For the price I can't complain too much!

Very recommended.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Compared to the pre-recorded video in steam, the 3D video was moving slower so the music finished half-way through it.

Otherwise, I found it quite boring, there isn't much to look at. But then, since I spent half the time looking around to see if something else was hapening elsewhere, it might be good thing that the little action there was was slow.

Overall, it's an interesting view of what music videos can become, but I can't say that this one was a good example. Try it if you want, it's free and short so you won't lose money nor time, and maybe you'll like it (it's art after all, so it's very subjective)

Product received for free\n\nGreat Experience, i thoroughly enjoyed the final part. The first time i saw it my jaw dropped becouse the scale was just amazing. I just wished i had packd my maneuver gear, to play some with those titans ;)

Pros  - Stunning visuals
- Visuals perfectly synchronized with the music.Cons  - The auto-locomotion feels wrong, it made me feel a little woozy. I think the experience could be improved by completely disabling it.
- Gaze-controlled menu.
Overall, a beautiful short VR experiment with a lot of work put in it. It's free, so you should definitely check it out!
